sentence.Network_en: He has said he will fire editorial employees without regard to seniority.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说过不管资历如何，任何编辑人员他都有可能解雇。

sentence.Network_en: They offered him a post befitting his seniority and experience.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们给他提供了一个同他资历相当的职位。

entry.def: A person's seniority in an organization is the importance and power that they have compared with others, or the fact that they have worked there for a long time.

example.ex: He has said he will fire editorial employees without regard to seniority.
example.tran: 他说过不管资历如何,任何编辑人员他都有可能解雇。

means.word_mean: 1. higher rank than that of others especially by reason of longer service

stems_affixes.word_buile: essence[n.基本,本质]+ial有……的→essential根本的,本质的
pre前+sen存在,实质+ent表形容词→present存在于前面,放到前面→赠送;上演;出席的;在场的
sen老+ior较……[的]→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 到场, 存在

senate[n.参议院, 上院]+or人→参议员

sen老+ior较……[的]→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
senior[adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生]+ity表名词→n.资历

sentences.en: The officers were listed in order of seniority.
sentences.cn: 官员列名以职位高低为序。

sentences.en: I sacrificed two years’ seniority by taking the overseas posting.
sentences.cn: 由于去国外任职, 我牺牲了两年的资历。
